Summary: Between 5 and 20 lights zig-zaging, fragmenting and coalescing, darting, and hovering.
divs: sighting details about a month ago my wife returned home after walking the dogs,claiming to have seen some ufo's. so i went out with her,sure that all it was were some car lights or planes. what i saw i could'nt explain at all. the next night we went back, this time i had my 15x70 binoculars. at a ridgeline about one mile south of red rock canyon,(approx nine miles from my location.)several lights were moving about the mountains. a bright one would rise up then split into a number of dimmer lights,in daisey chain formations. the wind was blowing good and the 15x70s were hard to keep trained on this strange event. being an amateur astronomer\tinkerer i rigged a tripod mount for my bino's,and a couple of nights ago, we went back. this time the show was downright erie. clearly i could make out sauceresque forms, several bright ships!? were moving behind the ridge casting a glowing pall, that back lit the foreground ridge. ocasionally one would rise up and over the crest and fragment into many, up to fifteen smaller components,always slightly angled always a dead straight line. this occurs due north of us, adding to this scene some would aproach the main body, from the west, or east, or appear out of nowhere glowing brightly then split into a new daisey chain a good number seemed to scan and comb the desert floor a good deal closer to us. appearing out of the dark darting and weaveing then going dark again. the play of lights between these and the main body seemed to me like semiphore. at certain points those in the hills dashed a span of three or four degrees in one or two seconds, i don't know how fast that is but at a distance of nine miles, seems a good clip. we watched this for a good two hours with no sign of a let up. the crazy part is i bet they will be there again tonight, and again tomarrow.
Object Flight Path: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering,Other
trends: There have been no other sightings in Cantil
This sighting has never been favorited.
